meanings.definition: The act of serving as a deacon in a church.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, his deaconing was greatly appreciated by the congregation.
meanings.sent2: She dedicated her life to deaconing at the local church.
meanings.sent3: The deaconing at the church bake sale was so efficient that they sold out in no time.
meanings.sent4: His deaconing was like a guiding light, leading the community towards kindness.
meanings.sent5: The deaconing role requires humility and compassion towards others.

meanings.definition: The practice of carrying out the duties of a deacon.
meanings.sent1: Her deaconing involved helping those in need and spreading positivity.
meanings.sent2: The deaconing at the charity event was heartwarming to witness.
meanings.sent3: He took his deaconing responsibilities very seriously, even helping the elderly cross the street.
meanings.sent4: In times of crisis, the deaconing of the community shines brightest.
meanings.sent5: The deaconing duties include assisting with church services and supporting the community.

meanings.definition: To perform the duties of a deacon.
meanings.sent1: He enjoys deaconing at the church every Sunday morning.
meanings.sent2: She will be deaconing at the upcoming wedding ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The children were deaconing with enthusiasm during the holiday play.
meanings.sent4: Deaconing with a smile can brighten someone's day.
meanings.sent5: They are deaconing together to make a positive impact on the community.
